title: Hugo Lloris suffers horrific elbow injury as Frenchman concedes opening goal against Brighton
text:
Tottenham captain Hugo Lloris suffered a horrific elbow injury after gifting Brighton their opening goal following a dropped catch.

The French international's handling had been found wanting on the goal line, allowing Neal Maupay to nod home.

Lloris was caught out by a floated cross into the penalty area, and had been forced to back pedal into his own net to prevent the ball crossing the line. His elbow could be seen visibly buckling as he landed.

Tottenham captain Hugo Lloris suffered a horrific elbow injury after gifted Brighton's opener

It's a nightmare start for Spurs on the South Coast.



Neal Maupay won't score an easier goal. pic.twitter.com/SuUfrFJXXH — Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) October 5, 2019

While the home side raced off to celebrate their early lead against the top flight strugglers, Lloris could be seen writhing in pain before concerned teammates signalled for Tottenham's medical team to race on.

The 32-year-old was filmed screaming in agony inside the net as he was tended to, and was given oxygen during a lengthy pause before being stretchered off the field.

BT Sport later reported that Lloris had been administered morphine and was taken to hospital.

The French international could be seen screaming in agony inside the net after the heavy fall

Lloris 🙏🏼 — David de Gea (@D_DeGea) October 5, 2019

Lloris was replaced by Paulo Gazzaniga, and looks set to spend a lengthy spell on the sidelines.

Manchester United goalkeeper David de Gea showed his support for Spurs' crocked star on Twitter following the unsightly injury at the Amex.

The visitors had been looking to bounce back from their 7-2 humiliation against Bayern Munich in mid-week, but instead got off to the worst possible start on the south coast as the pressure piled on boss Mauricio Pochettino.
